meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: Jail for Ex-Congressman In Lobbying Scandal Former Representative Bob Ney, the only member of Congress to admit guilt in the Jack Abramoff lobbying scandal, was sentenced to two and a half years in prison.
The Supreme Court announced a review of a ruling that substantially narrowed the application of a major provision of the McCain-Feingold campaign finance law.
Do Not Call, Write or How to get your name off those lists, so sales people won't call, junk mail won't come, and spam won't clog the in-box. (Well, so much spam, anyway.)
'Papa' Denny Doherty Dies A founder and lead singer of the Mamas and the Papas, the folk-pop group that was one of the most popular and influential American bands of the 1960s, he was 66.

Little Angels Crowding New York Cribs Joseline Liriano and Angel Miguel Solano named their son Angel when he was born in August. For the first time in a generation, an ethnic name is most popular for newborn Hispanic boys in New York City.

Inquiry Into Drug's Marketing Prosecutors in Illinois and Vermont have asked Eli Lilly turn over information about the way it promoted its bestselling drug Zyprexa, stepping up an inquiry into ''off label'' marketing.
A Home That's Not Your Own When a house or apartment is put on the market, sellers have to be prepared for a showing at any moment. If it's the toddler's nap time or dinner's on the stove, too bad.
A Post-Abortion Syndrome? Anti-abortion activists claim, despite social-science research, that women are traumatized by abortions, and are trying to use this to reframe the abortion debate.

Jail for Ex-Congressman In Lobbying Scandal Former Representative Bob Ney, the only member of Congress to admit guilt in the Jack Abramoff lobbying scandal, was sentenced to two and a half years in prison.
The Supreme Court announced a review of a ruling that substantially narrowed the application of a major provision of the McCain-Feingold campaign finance law.
Do Not Call, Write or How to get your name off those lists, so sales people won't call, junk mail won't come, and spam won't clog the in-box. (Well, so much spam, anyway.)
'Papa' Denny Doherty Dies A founder and lead singer of the Mamas and the Papas, the folk-pop group that was one of the most popular and influential American bands of the 1960s, he was 66.

Little Angels Crowding New York Cribs Joseline Liriano and Angel Miguel Solano named their son Angel when he was born in August. For the first time in a generation, an ethnic name is most popular for newborn Hispanic boys in New York City.

Inquiry Into Drug's Marketing Prosecutors in Illinois and Vermont have asked Eli Lilly turn over information about the way it promoted its bestselling drug Zyprexa, stepping up an inquiry into ''off label'' marketing.
A Home That's Not Your Own When a house or apartment is put on the market, sellers have to be prepared for a showing at any moment. If it's the toddler's nap time or dinner's on the stove, too bad.
A Post-Abortion Syndrome? Anti-abortion activists claim, despite social-science research, that women are traumatized by abortions, and are trying to use this to reframe the abortion debate.
